workflows.selectFacilities: Which facility do you belong to?
workflows.state-anchorDescription: Select this option if you want this status to be displayed in as many columns as there are people assigned to it. This option is ideal for states in which tasks are distributed among different workers.
workflows.state-entryPointDescription: Select this option if you want the tokens that enter the workflow to be placed here, when they come from a movement that does not specify a specific status or assigned person.
workflows.state-exitPointDescription: Select this option if you want tokens placed here to be considered archived. If the tab is a task from another tab, that task will be marked as Done; leaving a record of the user, date and time.
workflows.state-frontDescription: Select this option if you want this status to be displayed in as many columns as there are people assigned to it. This option is ideal for states in which tasks are distributed among different workers.
workflows.state-hideBoardDescription: Hides state in the worker tool.
workflows.state-lockInMovesDescription: It does not allow token movements towards this state. It will display an error message in the worker tool, in case you try to perform such a move.
workflows.substatesWithAndWithoutCards: Showing substates with or without cards
workflows.syncData: You are going to sync the workflow's data, do you want to continue?
workflows.workflowSubstateTargetCardsLimit: Substate target if card's limit reached
